Description: Fragment of weft-faced plain weave, undyed, cream woolleen cloth; Decorated with two tapestry bands (single warp threads) in dark blue and cream, design of vases with curving stems enclosing paired animals or dancing human figures, outer border of inverted dotted cusps; Several double rows of twining; warp: S spun, c.9 tpc; Weft: S Sun, c.30-32 tpc, c.50 tpc for tapestry; Edges ragged or cut, 2 internal selvedges; Sewing: S Spun, Z ply wool thread closing internal selvedges
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, brown box; Probably from a garment but not a tunic; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (2/11/1989)
Condition: Fair; some discolouration; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
